this post critically examines the concept of data privacy, suggesting that it may be an outdated idea in today's digital age. the hashtags #datenschutz (data protection) and #privatsphÃ¤reistveraltet (privacy is outdated) convey a sense of skepticism towards the notion that individuals can still maintain control over their personal information. the reference to "big brother" - a fictional character from george orwell's 1984, known for his constant surveillance and monitoring of society - implies that governments and corporations have access to an excessive amount of personal data. overall, the post reflects on the challenges of protecting personal information in the digital era while also questioning the effectiveness of existing measures to safeguard privacy.
